input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Smoking has a direct effect on effort and freckles. Effort has a direct effect on freckles. The overall probability of smoking is 81%. The probability of nonsmoking and freckles is 13%. The probability of smoking and freckles is 34%. Is the chance of freckles larger when observing smoking?
